Articles.Content:
Hello, this is a thread where people can share their creations that have had the most Delta-V in a single stock launch.

Rules

1.Your ships must be comprised of 100% stock parts, and must have made it to orbit in a single launch.

2. No bickering/bragging.

3. Have fun and enjoy other people's creations!
I got this rocket that gave me about 17km/s, enough to get to the moon and back:
Since this seems to be a craft showcase, I'll be moving it to the Spacecraft Exchange
With that much delta-V you could probably get past Jool and back... @redrobin

With that much delta-V you could probably get past Jool and back... @redrobin

Yea, I used this for RSS
That's cool, mine had about 12.5 km/s, but I cannot upload the picture.

Hello, this is a thread where people can share their creations that have had the most Delta-V in a single stock launch.

Rules

1.Your ships must be comprised of 100% stock parts, and must have made it to orbit in a single launch.

2. No bickering/bragging.

3. Have fun and enjoy other people's creations!

This has about 18,300 m/s dV (payload 0.04 ), and a TWR of no less than 1 on all stages. No asparagus, All stock except for MechJeb and KER.

I made it for a Kerbin circumnavigation challenge. Technically, it orbited, but I tried to hold it at 55km and 3,600 m/s surface speed the whole way.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
I'm just talking about ships in general, it could be a payload carrier, an interplanetary tug, or just a capsule. Whatever you choose.
